title: Work to build Britain own Iron Dome system that intercepts enemy rocket fire is already underway following Iranian missile attack on Israel , united kingdom army chief reveals
message:
Work to build Britain's own Iron Dome system that intercepts enemy rocket fire is already underway following the Iranian missile attack on Israel, a UK army chief has revealed.
Sir Radakin has also made his views that the UK needed an Iron Dome system in April.
They are armed with the Sky Sabre missile system, can simultaneously at destroy 24 different targets travelling at supersonic speeds.
Former Defence Minister Mark Francois has previously called for a 'UK equivalent of Israel's Iron Dome system' in an interview.
On the ground, there is the Royal Artillery's Sky Sabre missile system, which is Britain's only medium-range, ground-based air defence system.

title: Cargo ship hit by missile in Gulf of Aden in suspected attack by Yemen Houthi
message:
A missile struck an Antigua and Barbuda-flagged cargo ship in the Gulf of Aden in a suspected attack by the Houthis in Yemen, authorities said Sunday.
The missile hit the ship’s forward station, starting a fire that those on board later put out, the private security firm Ambrey said.
A second missile fired at the ship missed and people “on board small boats in the vicinity opened fire on the ship during the incident,” Ambrey added, though no one was hurt onboard.
The Houthis did not immediately claim the assault, though it can sometimes take hours or even days for them to acknowledge their attacks.
The Houthis have launched more than 50 attacks on shipping, killed three sailors, seized one vessel and sunk another since November, according to the U.S. Maritime Administration.

title: Cargo ship hit by missile in Gulf of Aden in suspected attack by Yemen Houthi rebels . No one hurt
message:
DUBAI: A missile struck an Antigua and Barbuda-flagged cargo ship in the Gulf of Aden on Sunday in a suspected attack by Houthi rebels in Yemen, authorities said.The missile hit the ship's forward station, starting a fire that those on board later put out, the private security firm Ambrey said.
It began after Hamas-led militants attacked Israel on Oct. 7, killing about 1,200 people and taking around 250 hostage.The Houthis have launched more than 50 attacks on shipping, killed three sailors, seized one vessel and sunk another since November, according to the US Maritime Administration.
A US-led airstrike campaign has targeted the Houthis since January, with a series of strikes May 30 killing at least 16 people and wounding 42 others, the rebels say.But while gaining more attention internationally, the secretive group has cracked down at dissent at home.
Eleven Yemeni employees of United Nations agencies and others working for aid groups have been detained by the Houthis under unclear circumstances, as the rebels face increasing financial pressure and airstrikes from the US-led coalition.
The rebels also recently sentenced 44 people to death.

title: Israeli Airstrike Kills Two In Lebanon
message:
(MENAFN- Gulf Times) Two people were killed on Saturday in an Israeli on the outskirts of the southern Lebanese town of Aitaroun, Lebanon's state news agency NNA said.
The Israeli military said in a statement that its had identified a Hezbollah fighter in the Aitaroun area, and that soon afterwards an Israeli aircraft had carried out an airstrike that hit the individual.
Israeli forces launched two missiles targeting a cafe at a station, causing significant damage to the premises and to the surrounding area, NNA said.
A security source told Reuters it was the first time the group used that model of rockets, having used the Falaq 1 previously.
Israel Defence Forces (IDF)“identified a Hezbollah fighter in the area of Aitaroun in southern Lebanon, and shortly afterward an IAF aircraft struck the fighter,” the Israeli military said in a statement.

title: Cargo ship hit by missile in Gulf of Aden in suspected attack by Yemen Houthi rebels . No one hurt
message:
Cargo ship hit by missile in Gulf of Aden in suspected attack by Yemen Houthi rebels.
No one hurtDUBAI, United Arab Emirates (AP) — A missile struck an Antigua and Barbuda-flagged cargo ship in the Gulf of Aden in a suspected attack by Houthi rebels in Yemen, authorities said Sunday.
The missile hit the ship's forward station, starting a fire that those on board later put out, the private security firm Ambrey said.
A second missile fired at the ship missed and people “on board small boats in the vicinity opened fire on the ship during the incident,” Ambrey added, though no one was hurt onboard.
The rebels did not immediately claim the assault, though it can sometimes take hours or even days for them to acknowledge their attacks.

title: Cargo ship hit by missile in Gulf of Aden in suspected attack by Yemen Houthi rebels
message:
A suspected attack by Yemen’s Houthi rebels has targeted an Antigua and Barbuda-flagged cargo ship in the Gulf of Aden, with a missile hitting the vesselDUBAI, United Arab Emirates -- A missile struck an Antigua and Barbuda-flagged cargo ship in the Gulf of Aden in a suspected attack by Houthi rebels in Yemen, authorities said Sunday.
The missile hit the ship's forward station, starting a fire that those on board later put out, the private security firm Ambrey said.
A second missile fired at the ship missed and people “on board small boats in the vicinity opened fire on the ship during the incident,” Ambrey added, though no one was hurt onboard.
The British military's United Kingdom Maritime Trade Operations center similarly reported the attack and fire late Saturday in the same area off Aden, saying “damage control is underway."
The rebels did not immediately claim the assault, though it can sometimes take hours or even days for them to acknowledge their attacks.

title: 4 killed , 5 injured in Israeli airstrikes in Lebanon
message:
Four people, including two Hezbollah members, were killed, and five others were injured in Israeli airstrikes on villages in southern Lebanon, Lebanese military sources told the media.
The sources, who spoke anonymously, said on Saturday that an Israeli warplane targeted a house in the village of Houla, killing two Hezbollah members and injuring three civilians, Xinhua news agency reported.
The sources added that another Israeli airstrike targeted, with two air-to-surface missiles, a commercial market in the village of Aitaroun, killing two civilians and wounding two others.
Tensions increased between Hezbollah and the Israeli army in the wake of the latter’s announcement of completing deployment for a major offensive against the former.
Israel then retaliated by firing heavy artillery toward southeastern Lebanon.

title: Two killed , fires rage in Lebanon after Israeli strikes - Newspaper
message:
BEIRUT: Israeli strikes on Saturday killed two people and sparked wildfires in southern Lebanon, state media said, with Hezbollah announcing the death of one fighter.
Hezbollah, a Hamas ally, has traded near-daily fire with Israeli forces in the eight months since the Gaza conflict began, triggered by Hamas’ October 7 raid.
The deadly clashes have intensified in recent weeks, causing multiple brush fires on both sides of the Israel-Lebanon border.
The movement later announced that one of its fighters was killed by Israeli fire.
More than eight months of border violence, which began on October 8, has killed 458 people in Leba­non, mostly fighters but including about 90 civilians, according to a tally.

title: 1 dead , multiple injured after shooting and stabbing at Lake Berryessa , Napa County Sheriff says
message:
1 dead, multiple injured after shooting and stabbing at Lake Berryessa, Napa Co. sheriff saysNAPA COUNTY, Calif. (KGO) -- One person is dead and multiple people are injured after a shooting and stabbing at the Oak Shore Day Use area of Lake Berryessa on Saturday, the Napa County Sheriff's Office said.
The incident was first reported at 5:30 p.m. when deputies were called for a report of a fight between people in the area.
Two stabbing victims were reportedly airlifted to local hospitals with serious injuries, but their conditions are unknown.
The sheriff's office says multiple other stabbing victims were being treated at local hospitals but the number of victims is unknown at this time.
The investigation is being led by Napa County Sheriff's detectives.

title: Hezbollah launches drone strike against Israeli artillery position in Shebaa Farms
message:
Hezbollah launches drone strike against Israeli artillery position in Shebaa FarmsIran Press TVSaturday, 08 June 2024 10:20 AMFighters from Lebanon's Hezbollah resistance movement have launched a retaliatory drone strike against an Israeli artillery position in the occupied Shebaa Farms in response to the regime's ongoing war on Gaza.
Earlier in the day, Hezbollah fighters targeted a group of Israeli soldiers, who had moved into the al-Raheb military base, with a salvo of artillery shells.
On Friday evening, the Lebanese resistance group struck a gathering of Israeli soldiers in the al-Tayhat Triangle region with a barrage of rockets.
Hezbollah fighters also launched a rocket barrage at Israeli troops stationed in an area at Netu'a Forest and targeted an Israeli military vehicle at the Birkat Risha outpost.
Previously, the group had pounded Israeli artillery bunkers in the Khirbet Maar base and a group of Israeli troops deployed nearby with artillery shells.

message:
4 killed, 5 injured in Israeli airstrikes in LebanonBeirut: Four people, including two Hezbollah members, were killed, and five others were injured in Israeli airstrikes on villages in southern Lebanon, Lebanese military sources told the media.
The sources, who spoke anonymously, said on Saturday that an Israeli warplane targeted a house in the village of Houla, killing two Hezbollah members and injuring three civilians, Xinhua news agency reported.
The sources added that another Israeli airstrike targeted, with two air-to-surface missiles, a commercial market in the village of Aitaroun, killing two civilians and wounding two others.

title: Syrian Arrested After Shooting Near US Embassy In Beirut
message:
Lebanese army forces turn back motorists as they close a road near the US embassy in Beirut on Wednesday (AFP photo)Lebanese army forces turn back motorists as they close a road near the US embassy in Beirut on Wednesday (AFP photo)(MENAFN- Jordan Times) BEIRUT - A Syrian was arrested after a shooting near the US embassy in Beirut on Wednesday, the Lebanese said, with the embassy saying its staff were safe.
The embassy, in the northern suburb of Awkar, "was subjected to gunfire by a person holding Syrian nationality", the army said in a statement on X, formerly Twitter.
"Thanks to the quick reaction" of the Lebanese army, security forces "and our embassy security team, our facility and our team are safe", it said on X.
An AFP photographer said access to the area around the embassy was blocked off, with a heavy army deployment in the area.
A judicial source told AFP that security forces were combing wooded areas near the embassy for any accomplices, adding that the shooter's wounds were "serious".

title: Attacks in Russian - Occupied Ukrainian Regions Leave 28 Dead , Moscow - Appointed Officials Say
message:
Russia-installed officials in the partially-occupied Ukrainian regions of Kherson and Luhansk said Ukrainian attacks left at least 28 people dead as Russia and Ukraine continued to exchange drone attacks overnight into Saturday.
Russian state news agency Tass cited Saldo as saying that Ukrainian forces first struck the town with a French-made guided bomb, then attacked again with a U.S.-supplied HIMARS missile.
Ukraine launched a barrage of drones across Russian territory overnight Friday, Russia’s Defense Ministry said Saturday.
“Most of the city is under the control of the defense forces,” Nazar Voloshin, spokesman for the Khortytsia ground forces formation, said on Ukrainian state TV.
Also on Saturday, Ukrainian officials said there was an attempt on the life of the ex-mayor of Kupiansk, a city in Ukraine’s northeastern Kharkiv region, on Friday.

title: Time for US to end the delays on arming Kyiv
message:
With the availability of commercial satellite imagery, the Russian military buildup just across the border from Kharkiv was no secret.
The White House denied each request out of a fear that Ukraine using American weapons to strike inside Russia would be too escalatory.
Perhaps the most consequential White House delay was over the delivery of the Army Tactical Missile System to Ukraine.
Even Ukraine’s supporters in Congress, Republicans and Democrats alike, have called on the White House to provide them.
President Biden needs to end the delays and understand that arming Ukraine to win, and not just to survive, is the fastest way to bring this war to an end.

title: Israel pummels refugee camps in Gaza - World
message:
The onslaught persisted, despite scrutiny on Israel after its warplanes carried out an attack on a UN-run school that a Gaza hospital said killed at least 37 people.
The Israeli military acknowledged it conducted the strike on the Nuseirat refugee camp, saying it targeted “terrorists”.
The UN agency for Palestinian refugees that ran the school, condemned Israel for striking the facility housing 6,000 displaced people.
The war, now in its ninth month, has brought widespread devastation to Gaza, with one in 20 people dead or wounded, according to the Palestinian health ministry.
Meanwhile, in a new diplomatic push, US Secretary of State Antony Blinken is set to visit Israel, Egypt, Jordan and Qatar from Monday.

title: Israel - Gaza live updates : Israel says it rescued 4 hostages
message:
Biden welcomed the safe return of four hostages from Gaza, pledging that the United States will not stop working until all hostages are home.
-ABC News’ Samy Zyara and Nasser AttaJun 08, 7:12 AMIsrael says it rescued 4 hostagesIsrael rescued four hostages alive from two locations in the heart of Nuseirat, Gaza, Israel said Saturday.
The rescued hostages have been transferred to the ‘Sheba’ Tel-HaShomer Medical Center and are in good condition, the IDF said.
ABC News has not confirmed if the weapons Israel received after Oct. 7 were used in the May 26 Rafah strike.
Even the Indomie that he was eating was still here,” he said, describing the aftermath of the deadly Rafah strike.

title: Bombing children is not self - defense : Gaza war protesters slam Biden in rally at White House
message:
"I no longer believe any of the words that Joe Biden says," Zaid, a protestor whose parents are Palestinian, told AFP.
"This 'red line' in his rhetoric is rubbish... it shows his hypocrisy and his cowardice," Zaid added.'
The protestors expressed distrust with the Biden administration and their response to the Israel-Hamas war.
"Biden's red line was a lie", said a poster while, "Bombing children is not self-defense," read another.
Prior to the protest, which saw charter buses bring in attendees from as far afield as Maine and Florida, the White House increased security with the installation of an additional anti-scale perimeter fence.

It began after Hamas-led militants attacked Israel on October 7, killing about 1,200 people and taking around 250 hostage.

title: Deputy shoots knife - wielding man in Jurupa Valley
message:
JURUPA VALLEY, Calif. — A Riverside County Deputy shot a knife-wielding man during a welfare check in Jurupa Valley Saturday morning, according to deputies.
That's when the department said the man came at a deputy with the knife, and the deputy shot him.
SUGGESTED: LASD deputy shot in back while sitting at traffic light; suspect arrestedNo other details were immediately available.
The man has not been identified, and the deputy who shot him has been placed on paid administrative leave.
The Riverside County District Attorney's Office and the Riverside Sheriff's Force Investigations Detail are investigating the shooting.

title: Missile strikes cargo ship off Yemen : security firm
message:
LONDON, June 9, 2024 (BSS/AFP) - An Antigua and Barbuda-flagged cargo ship caught fire after it was hit by a missile off the coast of Yemen, maritime security firm Ambrey said on Saturday.
"The ship was heading southwest along the Gulf of Aden at a speed of 8.2kts when the forward station was struck by a missile.
"No injuries were reported," the security firm added.
The attack comes amid a campaign of drone and missile strikes against Israeli-linked shipping by Yemen's Iran-backed Huthi rebels.
Since January, the United States and Britain have launched retaliatory strikes on Huthi targets in Yemen in response to the attacks on shipping.

title: Attacks in Russian - occupied Ukrainian regions leave 28 dead , Moscow - appointed officials say
message:
Russian-installed officials in the partially-occupied Ukrainian regions of Kherson and Luhansk said Ukrainian attacks left at least 28 people dead as Russia and Ukraine continued to exchange drone attacks overnight.
Russian state news agency Tass cited Saldo as saying that Ukrainian forces first struck the town with a French-made guided bomb, then attacked again with a US-supplied HIMARS missile.
Emergency Ministry employees carry a wounded person from the side of the damaged apartment building following Friday's Ukrainian missile attack on Luhansk, the capital of Russian-controlled Luhansk region, eastern Ukraine.
Ukrainian air defence overnight shot down nine out of 13 Russian drones over the central Poltava region, southeastern Zaporizhzhia and Dnipropetrovsk regions, and the Kharkiv region in the northeast, Ukraine’s air force said.
Ukrainian officials said there was an attempt on the life of the ex-mayor of Kupiansk, a city in Ukraine’s northeastern Kharkiv region, on Friday.

title: Five Somali soldiers and 47 Al - Shabaab militants killed north of Mogadishu
message:
ALBAWABA- The Somali government announced that five soldiers were killed in an Al-Shabaab attack approximately 350 kilometers north of Mogadishu.
The government stated that its forces received intelligence about a planned attack in the Seldir area and set up an ambush for the militants.
During the ensuing clashes in the Galgadud region, north of the capital, at least 47 Al-Shabaab militants were killed alongside the five soldiers, according to government authorities.
Local resident, Mohamed Hussein reported to AFP, "There was intense fighting in Seldir this morning after Al-Shabaab attacked from multiple directions.
On May 26, 2023, Al-Shabaab attacked a base in Bulo Marer, occupied by Ugandan soldiers from the African Union force, resulting in the deaths of at least 54 soldiers according to Ugandan authorities.

title: Rising Political Violence in Europe : Leaders Under Siege
message:
In a troubling trend, political violence is escalating across Europe, putting many leaders in direct danger.
Slovakia's Prime Minister Robert Fico was shot in an assassination attempt last month and remains in recovery.
On Friday evening, Danish Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen was assaulted in downtown Copenhagen.
Experts suggest that the rising tensions are fueled by deep societal divisions, migration pressures, and the ongoing war in Ukraine—Europe's largest conflict since World War II.
The most severe attack was against Fico, who has hinted that his pro-Russian and anti-American views made him a target.

title: Conspiracy theorist blew up Virginia house on purpose last year , shocking new body cam footage shows
message:
A conspiracy theorist purposefully blew up his Virginia home while authorities were trying to serve a search warrant in December, according to a new video released by law enforcement.
On December 4, a patrol officer was in the area when he heard what sounded like gunshots, officials said.
He ran into children at a nearby park who told him they were “scared,” body cam footage shows.
Several gunshots were heard from inside the home and officers at the scene can be ducking for cover.
Police then deployed tear gas inside the home in the hopes Yoo would finally give up, but to no avail.

title: Missile strikes cargo ship off Yemen : security firm
message:
- Advertisement -An Antigua and Barbuda-flagged cargo ship caught fire after it was hit by a missile off the coast of Yemen on Saturday night, maritime security firm Ambrey said.
“The ship was heading southwest along the Gulf of Aden at a speed of 8.2kts when the forward station was struck by a missile.
A second missile missed and “small boats in the vicinity opened fire on the ship” causing it to change direction to port.
The attack comes amid a campaign of drone and missile strikes against Israeli-linked shipping by Yemen’s Iran-backed Huthi rebels.

title: Two vessels catch fire in the Gulf of Aden after  unknown projectile strike
message:
British security firm Ambrey confirmed to Reuters that an Antigua-and Barbuda-flagged cargo ship was struck 83 nautical miles south-east of Aden and caught fire.
“The ship was heading south-west along the Gulf of Aden at a speed of 8.2 knots when the forward station was struck by a missile.
Persons on board small boats in the vicinity opened fire on the ship during the incident.”A second incident was reported, 70 nautical miles south-west of Aden three hours after the initial strike.
“The vessel was hit by an unknown projectile on the aft section, which resulted in a fire,” UKMTO said.
Houthi rebels have begun striking ships in the Red Sea and the Gulf of Aden since November, in support of Palestinians in Gaza, but have not claimed either attack.

title: Mette Frederiksen : All On Polish Man Who Attacked Denmark PM
message:
Photo : TwitterA 39-year-old Polish man was remanded in custody for 12 days on Saturday following an assault on Danish Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen , which occurred the previous day.
The prime minister was hit by the suspect as he approached him in Copenhagen's downtown center.
It's incredibly touching," Frederiksen told Ritzau news agency in a written statement.
A representative told Polish state radio, "Danish authorities have informed us that the person detained is a Polish citizen, who has been staying in Denmark for some time."
This event happened shortly after Slovakia's Prime Minister Robert Fico was the target of a botched assassination attempt that left him gravely injured.

title: Rescued Hostages Noa Argamani And Almog Meir Jan Shares Harrowing Details Of Captivity in Gaza
message:
Noa Argamani, one of the four hostages rescued by the IDF from Gaza, has shared her experiences during her time in captivity with her loved ones.
Argamani reported that she had limited exposure to daylight and learned some Arabic during her captivity, even conversing with her captors in Arabic.
Meanwhile, another of the rescued hostages, Almog Meir Jan, shared his experiences during his time in captivity directly with Channel 12.
During his captivity, Jan occasionally saw television broadcasts, including footage from rallies urging his release and that of the other hostages.
Upon his release, Jan asked his family if they had seen the video, indicating that he was unaware of what happened to it.

title: Technology impacting character of modern wars : Northern Command chief
message:
He said the technological advancement is constantly impacting the character of modern wars.
“In fact, all these domains are being refined with every passing day with the use of disruptive technologies, thereby increasing the complexities of wars,” Lt Gen Kumar said.
He urged the officer cadets to always lead with honour, serve with distinction and inspire those around with unwavering commitment to duty.
After reviewing the Parade, Lt Gen Kumar laid wreaths and offered floral tributes to pay homage to the brave alumni of the IMA at the War Memorial.
The ‘Pipping Ceremony’, where the Officer Cadets don the ranks of Commissioned Officer, was carried out by their parents and loved ones.

title: Modern Warfare Dynamics and the Future of Indian Military Cadets – Indian Defence Research Wing
message:
Modern Warfare Dynamics and the Future of Indian Military Cadets| BySOURCE: PTIGeneral Officer Commanding-in-Chief Northern Command, Lt Gen MV Suchindra Kumar, emphasized the evolving nature of modern warfare and the necessity for adaptability among new officers during his address at the Indian Military Academy’s (IMA) Passing out Parade.
Lt Gen Kumar pointed out how technological advances are reshaping the battlefield, with increasing use of space, cyber, and information warfare.
He stressed that modern combat increasingly revolves around ideas, intellect, and innovation, urging the gentlemen cadets to be at the forefront of these challenges.
As he reviewed the Parade, Lt Gen Kumar lauded the high level of training at the IMA and the importance of physical fitness, mental agility, and technical prowess in facing contemporary warfare’s complexities.
Following the Parade, a Pipping Ceremony saw 394 gentlemen cadets don the ranks of Commissioned Officers, ready to serve their nations.

title: Russo - Ukraine War - 08 June 2024
message:

title: Worthplaying |  Starship Troopers : Extermination  Leaving Early Access In October , Comes To Console , v0 . 8 Details , Casper Van Dien Joins Cast
message:

title: The German board game that changed the face of war
message:
This aborted invasion, like many of their plans, had been workshopped using Kriegsspiel (“war game”), a battle simulator.
Planning officers were divided into two teams, controlling painted lead-block troops representing German and enemy forces.
Most German officers thought it too radical to work, and those who supported it did so largely out of desperation – the Nazis were out of moves.
A Kriegsspiel ("war game") session in progressKriegsspiel had been used by German strategists for nearly a century, but it was far older than that.
He used the game to plan a range of astonishing victories that united the first German Empire.

title: Russia Lost 40 , 000 Soldiers in Ukraine War Last Month
message:
In May, Russian casualties in Ukraine reached a record high, with close to 40,000 soldiers lost in just 31 days of combat.
-Russian casualties in Ukraine are mounting, with May being the single-deadliest month in the war so far.
The Deadliest Month of the War in UkraineMay was the deadliest month of the war for the Russian forces.
According to the Ukrainian estimates, in May, the Russian forces lost approximately 38,940 men killed, wounded, or captured.
In terms of artillery, the Russian forces lost approximately 1,160 guns in May, marking a record since the launching of the full-scale invasion.

title: Forces : The Ukraine War and the American Army
message:
June 8, 2024: The Ukraine War is very much an American war because Russia and the United States have been the major military powers, and opponents, since the end of World War II.
This includes Korea (1950-53), Vietnam (1964-73), Kosovo War (1989-96), Gulf (Iraq) War (1990-91), Afghanistan War (2001-2021), Iraq/Islamic terrorists (2003-2011), Iraq Intervention (2014-2021), Syrian Civil War (ongoing since 2014).
In addition to these wars that involved American forces, often mainly airpower, there were dozens of smaller interventions which also involved few American troops other than airpower or warships offshore.
This includes the Ukraine War (ongoing since 2022) that began when Russia invaded Ukraine.
This has been the case since victory in the Spanish American War that lasted from April to December 1898.

title: South Carolina State Museum new World War II Exhibit unveiled at D - Day 80th Anniversary Salute
message:
COLUMBIA, S.C. (WIS) - As the nation continues to mark the 80th anniversary of D-Day, dozens came out to the South Carolina State Museum on Saturday for a special event marking the pivotal World War II battle.
The museum also used the occasion to unveil a new World War II exhibit, highlighting South Carolinians’ contributions during the global conflict.
The Shared Sacrifice: South Carolina in World War II exhibition gallery highlights stories of military personnel from across South Carolina and their contributions in World War II.
Many of the artifacts in the Shared Sacrifice exhibit were donated by people across the state.
Feel more informed, prepared, and connected with WIS. For more free content like this, subscribe to our email newsletter, and download our apps.

title: North Korea sends another wave of trash balloons into South Korea
message:
About 330 balloons carrying bags of trash had been sent by North Korea since Saturday night, of which about 80 have landed in South Korea, Seoul’s Joint Chiefs of Staff (JCS) said on Sunday.
South Korea’s National Security Council held an emergency meeting Sunday to discuss responses to the latest wave of balloons.
Trash from a balloon presumably sent by North Korea lies on scattered the ground in Seoul, South Korea on June 9, 2024.
South Korea Joint Chiefs of Staff/APIn May, North Korea responded by sending its own giant balloons south – containing trash, soil, pieces of paper and plastic, and what South Korean authorities described as “filth.”Kim said the balloons were “strictly a responsive act” to South Korea’s years-long practice of sending balloons with anti-North Korea leaflets the other way.
South Korea’s JCS said Saturday night that North Korea was “boosting its presumed trash balloons,” and warned that the wind direction may lead to balloons moving south.

title: The Yorkshire Steam Railway : All Aboard - Yesterday
message:
The Yorkshire Steam Railway: All AboardYesterday 12:00 PM to 1:00 PM Sunday 9 June Share Add toCalendar +Season 2 Episode 4 of 6 S SubtitlesWar Weekend takes place on the North York Moors Railway, celebrating the part played by the railways during the Second World War, with around 30,000 visitors expected to attend.

Further complications arise when a tree falls on the line, leading to a full track inspection before any trains are allowed to run.

title: Russia Combat Losses Up By 1 , 270 In Past Day
message:
(MENAFN- UkrinForm) Russia has lost a total of 518,560 and officers killed and wounded in action since the full-scale invasion, according to the estimates drawn by the Ukrainian side.
That's according to the General Staff of Ukraine's Armed Forces, Ukrinform reports.
In the past day alone, these losses rose by 1,270, the Ukrainian military notes.
Finland's military aid to Ukraine includes latest products under developmentThe latest reports on enemy losses are being verified.
As Ukrinform reported earlier, special operations units from Ukraine's Security Service in the past week engaged nine Russian tanks and four air defense systems, as well as eliminated 212 invaders.

title: NATO considering to create new special envoy post in Ukraine
message:
NATO is considering to establish a permanent envoy position in Kyiv as part of its long-term commitment to Ukraine amid the ongoing war with Russia, Western officials and U.S. congressional aides familiar with the matter told Foreign Policy.
The plan, expected to be announced at the NATO summit in Washington in July if approved, involves creating a "senior civilian representative" post in Ukraine.
The new envoy would coordinate NATO's support for Ukraine, including the delivery of military aid from various Western nations.
The proposed move is set against ongoing debates among NATO member countries about whether to deploy their own troops to Ukrainian territory.
Read also: Opinion: NATO states should send non-combat troops to UkraineWe’ve been working hard to bring you independent, locally-sourced news from Ukraine.

title: Haiti newly - installed interim PM in hospital
message: President Jovenel Moise was assassinated in 2021, leaving Haiti to this day without a president, while Prime Minister Ariel Henry resigned in March this year after he left Haiti to seek support for a Kenyan security mission and was unable to re-enter the country amid gang warfare and riots.

title: Biden Says Putin  Not Going to Stop at Ukraine
message:
US President Joe Biden on Saturday pledged Washington's support for Kyiv in its battle against the Russian invasion, warning that Vladimir Putin would "not stop" at Ukraine.
"Putin is not going to stop at Ukraine," Biden said alongside French President Emmanuel Macron after talks in Paris.
"All of Europe will be threatened, we are not going to let that happen," Biden told journalists during his state visit to France.
Both Biden and Macron on Friday met Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky in Paris, pledging support for the Ukrainian cause.
On Friday, Biden warned of the need to preserve American democracy and drew parallels between World War II and Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

title: A World War II veteran just married his bride near Normandy D - Day beaches – NBC Bay Area
message:
But World War II veteran Harold Terens and his sweetheart Jeanne Swerlin proved that love is eternal as they tied the knot Saturday inland of the D-Day beaches in Normandy, France.
Their respective ages — he’s 100, she’s a youngster of just 96 — made their nuptials an almost double-century celebration.
On D-Day, Terens helped repair planes returning from France so they could rejoin the battle.
Terens himself went to France 12 days later, helping transport freshly captured Germans and just-freed American POWs to England.
Following the Nazi surrender in May 1945, Terens again helped transport freed Allied prisoners to England before he shipped back to the U.S. a month later.

title: Basuto : a lost chapter in Malta war
message:

Basotho played football against the Royal Artillery, Royal Engineers and other regiments and corps, as well as against other Basotho coys.

title: Swiss vote on renewable energy plan for 2050 carbon neutrality
message:
The Swiss government wants to use a new climate bill to boost wind and solar power's current miniscule contribution to Switzerland's energy mix (Fabrice COFFRINI)Swiss voters were expected to approve in a referendum Sunday a law aimed at accelerating the development of renewable energy as the country aims for carbon neutrality by 2050.
They fear it will fast-track large-scale energy projects and see Switzerland's pristine Alpine landscapes plastered in wind turbines and solar panels.
They also deplore limitations on the possibilities for local residents to launch appeals against the construction of new renewable energy installations.
The SVP thinks renewable energies do not guarantee energy security due to their fluctuating nature.
The government acknowledges that court appeals against large energy projects "will probably be less likely to succeed than before".

title: Swiss vote on renewable energy plan for 2050 carbon neutrality
message:
Swiss voters were expected to approve in a referendum Sunday a law aimed at accelerating the development of renewable energy as the country aims for carbon neutrality by 2050.
They fear it will fast-track large-scale energy projects and see Switzerland's pristine Alpine landscapes plastered in wind turbines and solar panels.
They also deplore limitations on the possibilities for local residents to launch appeals against the construction of new renewable energy installations.
Largest party opposes lawSwitzerland's largest party, the hard-right Swiss People's Party (SVP), supports the referendum, above all in the name of defending civil nuclear power, which provided 32% of total energy production last year.
The government acknowledges that court appeals against large energy projects "will probably be less likely to succeed than before."

title: Biden to visit Aisne - Marne cemetery honoring US veterans , same site Trump skipped in 2018
message:
Paris CNN —President Joe Biden is set to visit the American cemetery outside Paris honoring World War I dead on Sunday, setting up a contrast with former President Donald Trump, who skipped a visit to the cemetery during a 2018 trip.
Biden will cap off a five-day trip to France paying his respects with a wreath-laying at the Aisne-Marne American Cemetery and Memorial before returning to Washington.
Trump, who was in Paris to commemorate the centennial of the end of World War I with other world leaders, blamed weather and safety issues for eschewing the cemetery visit.
CNN later reported that Trump referred to the fallen US service members at Aisne-Marne in crude and derogatory terms.
His former chief of staff, John Kelly, later confirmed to CNN several anecdotes in The Atlantic’s story, including the cemetery visit and comments about US soldiers killed in battle.

“(The town of) Carentan was happy to host your wedding, and us, your wedding dinner,” he told the couple.
On D-Day, Terens helped repair planes returning from France so they could rejoin the battle.

title: Burnout red flags to look out for as one in five suffer symptoms
message:
According to recent statistics, a staggering 76% of employees experience burnout at work, highlighting the urgent need to address this pervasive issue.
The consequences of burnout extend beyond the workplace, affecting mental and physical well-being, relationships, and overall quality of life.
Decreased PerformanceA decline in work performance, increased errors, and difficulty concentrating or staying motivated are red flags for decreased performance, often associated with burnout.
Physical SymptomsPersistent headaches, muscle tension, gastrointestinal issues, or other physical ailments without a clear medical cause are common physical symptoms of burnout.
Learning to say no to excessive demands and practising assertiveness can help maintain a healthy work-life balance.

title: Just Married : He 100 , She 96 - World War II Vet & Bride Wed Near Normandy D - Day Beaches
message:
But World War II veteran Harold Terens and his sweetheart Jeanne Swerlin proved that love is eternal as they tied the knot Saturday inland of the D-Day beaches in Normandy, France.
Their respective ages — he’s 100, she’s a youngster of just 96 — made their nuptials an almost double-century celebration.
On her way into the nuptials, the bubbly bride-to-be said: “It’s not just for young people, love, you know.
The location was the elegant stone-worked town hall of Carentan, a key initial D-Day objective that saw ferocious fighting after the June 6, 1944, Allied landings that helped rid Europe of Adolf Hitler’s tyranny.
On D-Day, Terens helped repair planes returning from France so they could rejoin the battle.

title: Gaza war protesters slam Biden in  red line  rally at White House
message:
WASHINGTON, June 9, 2024 (BSS/AFP) - Thousands of Gaza war protesters held a "red line" rally near the White House on Saturday, voicing anger at what they said is US President Joe Biden's tolerance of Israel's bloody military campaign against Hamas.
The White House said in May that a deadly Israeli strike on Rafah did not cross a "red line" that Biden had seemingly set two months earlier when asked about a potential invasion of the southern Gazan city.
"This 'red line' in his rhetoric is rubbish... it shows his hypocrisy and his cowardice," Mahdawi told AFP.
The protesters -- almost all wearing red clothing -- held Palestinian flags and signs saying "Biden's red line was a lie" and "Bombing children is not self-defense."
The White House stepped up security with an additional anti-scale perimeter fence ahead of the demonstration, which saw chartered buses ferrying in people from as far afield as Maine and Florida.

title: Swiss vote on renewable energy plan for 2050 carbon neutrality
message:
Swiss voters were expected to approve in a referendum Sunday a law aimed at accelerating the development of renewable energy as the country aims for carbon neutrality by 2050.
They fear it will fast-track large-scale energy projects and see Switzerland's pristine Alpine landscapes plastered in wind turbines and solar panels.
They also deplore limitations on the possibilities for local residents to launch appeals against the construction of new renewable energy installations.
The SVP thinks renewable energies do not guarantee energy security due to their fluctuating nature.
The government acknowledges that court appeals against large energy projects "will probably be less likely to succeed than before".

title: Opinion : What a WWI cemetery in France means to every Mainer
message:
It was a turning point in World War I, a key component of Marine Corps lore and became the final resting place of 2,289 Americans, now buried in the nearby Aisne-Marne Cemetery.
Today, as part of a commemorative D-Day trip to Europe, America’s sitting president is scheduled to visit the site.
More than 100,000 courageous Marines, soldiers, sailors, nurses and other military personnel who sacrificed their lives for freedom during World War I and World War II lay to rest in sacred sites like Aisne-Marne.
That Trump has repeatedly disregarded the rule of law and disparaged veterans and the concept of service is well known.
What is unknown is what might the fallen heroes at Belleau Wood have said about a man like the former president.

title: Russia Is Sending Young Africans to Die in Its War Against Ukraine
message:
(Bloomberg) -- The Kremlin has forced thousands of migrants and foreign students to fight alongside Russian troops in its war against Ukraine, adding extra manpower for its offensive in the Kharkiv region, according to assessments from European officials.
Russia’s practice of sending migrants and students into battle under duress dates back to earlier in the war, another European official said.
A spokeswoman for the Russian Foreign Ministry didn’t respond to an email seeking comment.
A senior Ukrainian official said they have seen an uptick in the number of foreign fighters among the prisoners Ukraine has captured on the battlefield.
There are 35,000-37,000 African students currently in Russia, according to Yevgeny Primakov head of Rossotrudnichestvo, an organization devoted to spreading knowledge about Russia abroad.

title: Neo - Nazi group Blood Tribe claims responsibility for swastika displays in Pierre , Deadwood
message:
Christopher Pohlhaus, leader of Blood Tribe, a neo-Nazi group, claimed his members were responsible for the display in a hostile response to South Dakota Gov.
According to the Anti-Defamation League, the Blood Tribe is a neo-Nazi group which depicts itself as a hardcore white supremacist group and reveres Nazi dictator Adolf Hitler as a deity.
He added South Dakota Highway Patrol officers gave them orders to disperse as a result, to which they immediately complied.
A group of people believed to be part of the neo-Nazi group "Blood Tribe" march behind swastika flag-bearers in Deadwood, South Dakota, Saturday, June 8, 2024.
According to the ADL, Blood Tribe has held various protests across the country since at least March 2023.

title: More CPs mod for Battle for Middle - earth
message:
***If you downloaded the mod before 9 June 2024 download the mod again so you have latest version***Installation: Put morecp.big into your C:\Program Files (x86)\EA GAMES\The Battle for Middle-earth (tm) folderUninstall: Just delete morecp.bigAbout: This mod changes the command point limit (population limit) in skirmish and the campaign.
For good factions, the command point limit is now 600 (For the campaign it now starts at 300 and caps at 600).
For evil factions, the command point limit is now 1200 (For the campaign it now starts at 600 and caps at 1200).
Launch mod from shortcut instead (play other mods/multiplayer without compatibility issues):1: Put morecp.big into your C:\Program Files (x86)\EA GAMES\The Battle for Middle-earth (tm) folder2: ensure file name extensions are enabled then rename morecp.big to morecp.big.shortcut3: create a shortcut of the .exe (right click lotrbfme.exe and select create shortcut)4: right click the shortcut and select properties5: Change the target field to "C:\Program Files (x86)\EA GAMES\The Battle for Middle-earth (tm)" -mod "C:\Program Files (x86)\EA GAMES\The Battle for Middle-earth (tm)\morecp.big.shortcut"6: You can now launch the mod directly from the shortcut or play the vanilla game from the original .exeNote: This mod is known to work with patches 1.06 and 1.03.
Note: As long as everyone has the latest version of the More CPs mod, it should work in multiplayer.

title: Lest We Forget gearing up for big D - Day reenactment
message:
With the anniversary of D-Day this past Thursday, Lest We Forget is making the final plans for its D-Day reenactment planned at Tiscornia Beach in St. Joseph for later this month.
Group President Larry Wozniak tells us the big day will be June 22.
Wozniak says after the battle reenactments at Tiscornia Beach, events that weekend will move to the Southwest Michigan Regional Airport.
Wozniak says for the battle reenactments, the parking lot at Tiscornia Beach will be closed and people can park at nearby lots on Momany Drive.
Wozniak notes some World War II veterans are coming into town for the weekend, including one man who’s 106.

message:

For evil factions, the command point limit is now 1200 (For the campaign it now starts at 600 and caps at 1200).
